page.title: 02Restoration AT Gunton Hall
page.content: Gunton Hall,built in 1742 for the 1st Baronet Harbord by Mathew Brettingham was until recently a derelict mansion. It was bought in 1980 by Kit Martin, architect, who has since rebuilt the cottages round the 3 courtyards and converted the kitchens,bakeries, laundries,breweries,coach houses and stables,making a total of 20 dwellings in the service area.The Hall itself has been converted with minimal changes architecture into 4 large houses.The latest restoration involves the rebuilding of the burnt out ballroom block,the result of the disastrous fire of 1882 The complex of the 24 houses,now privately owned appears very much as Samuel Wyatt designed it when he trebled the size of the origonal squires house for the Lord Suffield in the 1780s.
